    • Method Detail

      • add

        public static void add(java.lang.String name,
                       SM_Robot.Electronics e,
                       int channelnumber)
        This method is overloaded several times. It adds a new electronics element to the robot.
        Parameters:
        name - the name you want for the electronics you add.
        e - the type of electronics @see #Electronics
        channelnumber - the channel number of the new electronics

      • add

        public static void add(java.lang.String name,
                       SM_Robot.Electronics e,
                       int channelnumber1,
                       int channelnumber2)
        This method overloads the previous method. It is for electronics that have two channels
        Parameters:
        name - the name you want for the electronics you add.
        e - the type of electronics @see #Electronics
        channelnumber1 - the first channel number of the new electronics
        channelnumber2 - the seoond channel number of the new electronics

      • setInverse

        public static void setInverse(java.lang.String n,
                              boolean isInverted)
        This method that change the invert state of a specific motor group
        Parameters:
        n - name of the motor group you want to change invert state
        isInverted - the invert state you want to set to the motor group

      • movePercent

        public static void movePercent(java.lang.String n,
                               SM_Robot.JoyStick j,
                               SM_Robot.Axis a)
        move motor group in precent output mode.
        Parameters:
        n - the name of the motor group
        j - joystick that provides percent output value
        a - the asix of the joystick

      • moveDistance

        public void moveDistance(java.lang.String n,
                         double distance)
        move robot in PID mode, usually for uppersystem or autonomous.
        Parameters:
        n - the name of target motor group
        distance - the distance or the error you want to set to the robot

      • moveDistance

        public void moveDistance(java.lang.String n,
                         SM_Robot.JoyStick j,
                         SM_Robot.Button b,
                         double distance)
        move robot in PID mode, usually for uppersystem or autonomous. Activate with a button
        Parameters:
        n - the name of target motor group
        j - the joystick that contains the activate button @see #Joystick
        b - after driver press this button the robot move the distance
        distance - the distance or the error you want to set to the robot

      • turnOff

        public void turnOff(java.lang.String n,
                    SM_Robot.JoyStick j,
                    SM_Robot.Button b)
        deactivate the target solenoid after a button is pressed.
        Parameters:
        n - the name of the target solenoid
        j - the joystick that contains deactivate button
        b - after this button the target solenoid is deactivated

      • turnOn

        Parameters:

        j - the joystick that contains activate button
        b - after this button the target solenoid is activated

      • set_West_Coast_Drive

        public static void set_West_Coast_Drive(java.lang.String right,
                                        java.lang.String left)
        set the two motor groups to left and right side of a west coast drive
        Parameters:
        right - the name of motor group that is assigned to right side
        left - the name of motor group that is assigned to left side

                               SM_Robot.Axis a1,

        Parameters:
        j - the joystick that controls the west coast drive
        a1 - the forward axis
        a2 - the turn axis
